column4: Bobweaver, ok do you want me to pastebin the output from that grep?
Bobweaver, http://paste.ubuntu.com/1375508/
dkms status; is also interesting if you haven't already pasted that
yeah added means it hasn't built yet, are we sure the headers are installed? dpkg -l 'linux-headers*'
I've run that, but the output is not meaninful to me, want me to pastebin it
ah yeah, sudo apt-get install linux-headers-$(uname -r);
you have one of the packages but you need the arch specific version too
you may want linux-headers-generic too so future kernel upgrades will rebuild the nvidia module
make sure you type that command exactly, I see bobweaver posted it earlier
do I get that with apt-get install linux-headers-generic ?
yes
after that, check: dkms status; to see if the module built
it should say: nvidia-current, 304.64: installed
http://paste.ubuntu.com/1375547/
looks like it has to me
yep looks good to me too
definitely a good idea to reboot after rebuilding the nvidia module
yay freak yes fixed
excellent, glad to hear it
nvidia-settings?
it is okay, it is bug 1068341
yeah it is unfortunately a bit buggy, but as long as you have linux-headers-generic install you should be good from now on
